to need 500 grams of either minced pork
or minced beef or even chicken would

so you don't want very much oil to come
out when you're frying it
you'll also need a handful of kaffir

read spiritually which is mostly for
color a pinch of sugar and some extra

take your lemongrass slice off the

the outer tough layers and then you can
just really finely shave the lemongrass
so the finer you shave it the more
flavor it will add to the dish and also
the easier it will be to chew in order
to prepare your kaffir lime leaves you
want to grab about five or six or seven
leaves and they always come as a pair so
that should be about 10 to 15 leaves
then I like to fold them over so you've
got a nice layered sandwich of kaffir
lime leaves then you can just slice off
any of the big stems if there are any

spiritually you can just cut off the
stem
then slice the chili in half and then

the first step is to turn on your stove
to a medium-high heat and heat up your
pan and then add about three tablespoons
of southern Thai curry paste now since
this is a dry curry we're not going to
use any oil so it should be really dry
and the trick is to add a spoon of your
minced meat to the curry paste
to give it a little moisture as you're
frying keep on frying your curry paste
with just that one spoon of minced meat
for about two to three minutes and
that's really just going to bring out
the flavor of that curry paste as you
fry it and then you can go ahead and add
in the rest of your minced meat your pan
should be very hot due to the dryness
and it should start to stick to the
bottom of the pan so you want to really
work your pan or your wok and really
scrape the bottom and try to get all
that good flavor off the bottom it
should be nice and dry stir-fry the meat
until it's broken into small pieces and
almost all the way cooked through then
you can toss in just a pinch of sugar
give it a quick stir then go in with
your lemongrass and mix that in followed
by your shaved kaffir lime leaves and
then stir-fry it for about a minute just
a few seconds before turning your heat
off you want to add the sliced red
spiritually and stir fry for another few
